concept.title: Deploying Configuration Files in JAR Files
concept.shortdesc: This section provides a procedure and an example for deploying configuration files in JAR files.

ol.li: Set the system properties to point to the files as they reside in the jar file.

Include the jar file in your
CLASSPATH.
Verify the jar file copies are the only ones visible to the application at runtime. searches the CLASSPATH after searching other locations, so the files cannot be available in the other search areas.
Start your application. The configuration file is loaded from the jar file.

p.b: Example of Deploying a Configuration JAR

conbody.p: The following example deploys the cache configuration file, myCache.xml, in my.jar. The following displays the contents of my.jar:
conbody.codeblock: % jar -tf my.jar META-INF META-INF/MANIFEST.MF myConfig/ myConfig/myCache.xml
conbody.p: In this example, you would perform the following steps to deploy the configuration jar file:

ol.li: Set the system property, gemfire.cache-xml-file, to myConfig/myCache.xml
Set your CLASSPATH to include my.jar.
Verify there is no file named myCache.xml in ./myConfig/myCache.xml, the current directory location of the file

conbody.p: When you start your application, the configuration file is loaded from the jar file.
